title: cudnn build error ::: OSError: [Errno 17] File exists
body:
Hello, 
          I tried to install cudnn I got an error because the symlink says the include file already exist

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install cudnn@7.6.4.38-10.1-linux-x64%gcc@8.3.1

error in attachment

[cudnn_build_error.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5117368/cudnn_build_error.txt)

```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

* **Spack:** 0.15.4-636-febc8cc
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-power9le

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->

[spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5117379/spack-build-out.txt)
[spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5117393/spack-build-env.txt)


<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->

@adamjstewart

Apparently the symlink try to copy twice the include files, I tried a quick-and-dirty fix commenting the last 2 lines in 

/opt/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/cudnn/package.py

...
```python
    def install(self, spec, prefix):
        install_tree('.', prefix)

        if 'target=ppc64le: platform=linux' in spec:
            symlink(os.path.join(prefix, 'targets', 'ppc64le-linux', 'lib'),
                    prefix.lib)
####            symlink(os.path.join(prefix, 'targets', 'ppc64le-linux', 'include'),
####                   prefix.include)
```
This removed the error and I am keeping installing other software in my stack but please tell what is the proper fix for this bug.

Thanks,
Simone
